cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as a group of concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. Then the Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: Cosmic Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively).

alternateConfigurations.name: Layered Realms
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below.

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane, where all four elements churn in chaos; an Overheaven, where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld, where evil deities and Fiends reside.

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it.

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Abyss
planes.philosophicalEssence: All that is perverse, gruesome, and chaotic. Entropic corruption and decay.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Loathsome corruption; temptation to turn against allies to survive.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Varies by layer; generally hostile and corrupting.

temperature.description: Varies enormously by layer, from tropical jungles to frozen oceans.

layers.name: The Plain of Infinite Portals
layers.description: On layer 1, corroded iron fortresses defend routes to lower layers. Under a glaring red sun, the rocky ground contains gaping craters that are portals to other layers of the Abyss.

notableLocations.name: Broken Reach
notableLocations.description: A fortress containing the portal leading to Plague-Mort in the Outlands. Ruled by a succubus named Red Shroud. Those who can prove their strength can stay unharmed for a few days.

layers.environmentalDescription: Rocky ground with gaping craters under a glaring red sun. Iron fortresses dot the landscape.

layers.name: Azzagrat
layers.description: Graz'zt's corrupt, decadent city is split across layers 45, 46, and 47. Bustling markets and pleasure palaces draw visitors seeking obscure magical lore and perverse delights.

notableLocations.name: Argent Palace
notableLocations.description: Graz'zt's seat of power in the city of Zelatar.

notableLocations.name: Zelatar
notableLocations.description: City whose bustling markets and pleasure palaces draw visitors from across the multiverse.

ruler.name: Graz'zt
ruler.title: Demon Lord
ruler.description: Embodies manipulation and cruelty, tempting mortals with the promise of appalling delights and decadent luxuries.

layers.environmentalDescription: A veneer of civility and courtly comity by Graz'zt's command, but holds as much danger as any other part of the Abyss.

layers.name: The Demonweb
layers.description: On layer 66, Lolth's web snares all and hides portals to other planes. An immense network of thick, magical webbing that forms passageways and cocoon-like chambers.

notableLocations.name: Demonweb Pits
notableLocations.description: Bottomless pits far beneath the dungeons where the Spider Queen dwells with her most loyal servants—yochlol demons.

ruler.name: Lolth
ruler.title: Demon Queen of Spiders
ruler.description: Whose schemes entangle entire civilizations on worlds across the multiverse. Of all demon lords, she might have the most active interest in the worlds of the Material Plane.

layers.environmentalDescription: Immense network of thick, magical webbing forming passageways and cocoon-like chambers. Structures, ships, and other objects caught in the webbing.

layers.name: The Gaping Maw
layers.description: Layer 88 is a malevolent wilderness surrounding Demogorgon's ocean fortress. A vast wilderness of brutality and horror where even powerful demons are overcome by fear.

notableLocations.name: Abysm
notableLocations.description: Demogorgon's fortress of two serpentine towers topped with enormous fanged skulls, emerging from a turbid sea. Echoes of Demogorgon's turbulent thoughts tear at the minds of creatures who enter.

ruler.name: Demogorgon
ruler.title: Prince of Demons, the Sibilant Beast
ruler.description: A two-headed monster who yearns for nothing less than undoing the order of the multiverse.

layers.environmentalDescription: Massive primeval continent covered in dense jungle, surrounded by endless expanse of ocean and brine flats.

layers.name: Thanatos
layers.description: On layer 113, an endless graveyard hosts Orcus and the sleepless dead. A land of bleak mountains, barren moors, ruined cities, and forests of twisted black trees under a black sky.

notableLocations.name: Everlost
notableLocations.description: A vast palace crafted of obsidian and bone, set in a howling wasteland called Oblivion's End. Surrounded by tombs and graves dug into the sheer slopes of narrow valleys, creating a tiered necropolis.

notableLocations.name: Oblivion's End
notableLocations.description: A howling wasteland surrounding the palace of Everlost.

ruler.name: Orcus
ruler.title: Demon Prince of Undeath, the Blood Lord
ruler.description: A brooding and nihilistic entity who yearns to make the multiverse a place of death and despair, forever unchanging except by his will.

layers.environmentalDescription: Bleak mountains, barren moors, ruined cities, and forests of twisted black trees under a black sky. Undead swarm across the plane.

layers.name: The Slime Pits
layers.description: Layer 222, a fetid realm of ooze and fungi, obeys the whims of Juiblex and Zuggtmoy. A bubbling morass of fetid sludge.

notableLocations.name: Zuggtmoy's Palace
notableLocations.description: Two dozen immense mushrooms, among the largest in existence, hollowed into grand chambers and twisting corridors. Surrounded by a field of acidic puffballs and poisonous vapors.

ruler.name: Juiblex
ruler.title: Demon Lord of Slimes and Oozes, the Faceless Lord
ruler.description: An amorphous mass that lurks in the abyssal depths. Cares nothing for cultists or mortal servants; sole desire is to turn all creatures into formless copies of itself.

layers.environmentalDescription: Bubbling morass of fetid sludge. Vast expanses of caustic slimes. Strange organic forms rise from the oceans of ooze.

layers.name: The Death Dells
layers.description: Yeenoghu and his gnoll servants prowl layer 422—a cruel, desolate realm. Creatures must hunt to survive. Even plants try to snare the unwary.

ruler.name: Yeenoghu
ruler.title: Gnoll Lord
ruler.description: Hungers for slaughter and senseless destruction. Delights in sorrow and hopelessness.

layers.environmentalDescription: Ravines and badlands where creatures must hunt to survive. Even plants try to snare the unwary to bathe their roots in blood.

layers.name: The Endless Maze
layers.description: Layer 600's endless labyrinth turns visitors into Baphomet's prey. A never-ending dungeon with the Horned King's enormous palace at its center.

notableLocations.name: Baphomet's Palace
notableLocations.description: An enormous palace at the center of the maze. A confusing jumble of crooked hallways and myriad chambers, surrounded by a mile-wide moat concealing submerged stairs and tunnels.

ruler.name: Baphomet
ruler.title: Horned King, Prince of Beasts
ruler.description: Embodies bestial bloodlust. Wants civilization to crumble and all mortals to embrace their predatory instincts.

layers.environmentalDescription: Never-ending dungeon labyrinth.

hazards.name: Abyssal Corruption
hazards.description: The corruption of the Abyss affects visitors. Its virtually endless layers spiral downward into ever more appalling forms. Much of the plane seems to be in a decaying, crumbling, or corroded state.
hazards.sourceReference: See 'Curses and Magical Contagions' in chapter 3.

portals.name: Crater Portals
portals.destination: Other layers of the Abyss, Pandemonium, Sigil, Plague-Mort, Astral Plane

notableEntities.name: Juiblex
notableEntities.title: Demon Lord of Slimes and Oozes

adventureThemes: Confronting the evil in one's own heart
Resisting temptation to turn against allies
Desperate last stand against endless demon hordes
Seeking holy relics left behind by lost heroes
Contamination of other planes by the Abyss

planes.name: Acheron
planes.philosophicalEssence: Enforced order leading to crushed spirits and broken hopes. Unending conflict and rigid conformity.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Instills bloodlust in visitors.

physicalProperties.shape: Immense iron blocks drifting through an airy void.

temperature.description: Varies by layer from normal to extreme cold.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Colliding iron blocks send shudders through the plane.

layers.name: Avalas
layers.description: Spirit soldiers wage endless wars across debris-strewn battlefields. The largest blocks of iron gravitate here.
layers.environmentalDescription: Debris-strewn battlefields on immense iron blocks.

layers.name: Thuldanin
layers.description: Pitted, hollow cubes are filled with the cast-off machinery of war.
layers.environmentalDescription: Hollow cubes filled with abandoned war machinery.

layers.name: Tintibulus
layers.description: Jagged blocks tumble in darkness, holding frozen memories sapped by the River Styx and crystallized into fleeting images.
layers.environmentalDescription: Tumbling jagged blocks in darkness with crystallized memories.

layers.name: Ocanthus
layers.description: Maelstroms of razor-sharp debris swirl above a mire of black ice. Tiny shards break off from an icy mire in its deepest recesses and gradually assemble into the perfect cubes of Avalas.
layers.environmentalDescription: Razor-sharp debris maelstroms above black ice.

hazards.name: Acheron Bloodlust
hazards.description: The nature of Acheron instills bloodlust in those who visit the plane.

adventureThemes: Confrontation with bleak nihilism of unending conflict
Harsh reality of authoritarian rule
Uncaring pressures of social conformity
Questioning what you are fighting for
Preventing villain from scavenging war machinery
Retrieving secrets from imprisoned memories

planes.name: Arborea
planes.philosophicalEssence: Extremes: stupendously craggy mountains, forests of monstrously huge trees. Wild-hearted nature spirits. Violent moods and deep affections.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Charged with excitement. Music always seems to be playing. Visitors may experience desperate desire to return after leaving.

temperature.description: Sudden squalls and warm flares of sunlight.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Sudden squalls brew out of nowhere, pass within minutes, leave behind warm flares of sunlight.

layers.name: Arvandor
layers.description: Towering trees, colorful wildflowers, abundant grain, and delicious fruit create a lush environment.
layers.environmentalDescription: Lush, verdant environment of towering trees and colorful wildflowers.

layers.name: Aquallor
layers.description: An eternal ocean fed by the River Oceanus is home to teeming sea life and mighty storms.
layers.environmentalDescription: Eternal ocean with teeming sea life and storms.

layers.name: Mithardir
layers.description: A desert of white sand is abandoned by whatever powers once lived there.
layers.environmentalDescription: White sand desert, abandoned.

adventureThemes: Discovering who you are when masks fall away
Emotional honesty and unfettered emotion
Rage as common and honored as joy
Yearning to return after leaving
Investigating lost powers of Mithardir

planes.name: Arcadia
planes.philosophicalEssence: Orchards of perfectly lined trees, ruler-straight streams, orderly fields. Purity is eternal and nothing intrudes on harmony.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Suffused with vigorous life energy bestowing great vitality on visitors.

temperature.description: Weather governed by four allied demigods called the Storm Kings.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Weather governed by the Storm Kings: Cloud King, Wind Queen, Lightning King, and Rain Queen.

layers.name: Abellio
layers.description: Everything in these fields of plenty is dedicated to the good of all.
layers.environmentalDescription: Fields of plenty dedicated to the common good.

layers.name: Buxenus
layers.description: Military forces gather their strength, amid pleasant valleys and orchards, to reclaim the lost layer of Menausus—now part of Mechanus.
layers.environmentalDescription: Pleasant valleys and orchards with military encampments.

timeFlow.description: Night and day determined by a floating orb. Half radiates sunlight (day), half sheds moonlight (night). The orb rotates evenly without fail.

environmentalEffects.name: Arcadian Vitality
environmentalEffects.description: Arcadia is suffused with a vigorous life energy that bestows great vitality on visitors.

notableEntities.name: Cloud King
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four demigods governing weather in Arcadia.

notableEntities.name: Wind Queen
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four demigods governing weather in Arcadia.

notableEntities.name: Lightning King
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four demigods governing weather in Arcadia.

notableEntities.name: Rain Queen
notableEntities.title: Storm King
notableEntities.description: One of four demigods governing weather in Arcadia.

adventureThemes: Tension between individual freedom and societal responsibility
Conforming to social expectations versus individuality
Common good versus personal desires

planes.name: Astral Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A realm of thought and dream, where visitors travel as disembodied souls to reach the Outer Planes.

physicalProperties.shape: A great silvery sea with swirling wisps of white and gray and motes of light.
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: No aging or hunger/thirst on this plane.

timeFlow.description: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst.

hazards.name: Psychic Wind
hazards.description: A storm of thought that batters travelers' minds rather than their bodies. Made of lost memories, forgotten ideas, and subconscious fears. First sensed as rapid darkening of the silver-gray sky. After 1d4 minutes, area becomes dark as a moonless night. Passes quickly and sky returns to normal in 1 minute.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Each traveler caught in a psychic wind makes this save.

onFailure.description: Traveler suffers a random effect from the Psychic Wind Psychic Effects table.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A deep thrum in the ethereal matter. Travelers with Passive Perception 15 or higher receive 1 minute of warning.

entries.description: At the end of the travel time, the characters arrive at a location other than the intended destination.
Sent through a random color pool (roll on the Astral Color Pools table).

entries.durationDescription: 1 minute; repeat save end of each turn, ending on success.
5 (1d10) hours; ends if you take damage or another creature shakes you awake.

portals.colorOrAppearance: Two-dimensional pools of rippling colors, 1d6 × 10 feet in diameter.

civilizations.name: Tu'narath
civilizations.description: Perhaps the most infamous city built on a dead god's remains.
civilizations.location: Petrified remains of a dead god

specialRules.name: No Aging or Biological Needs
specialRules.description: Creatures on the Astral Plane don't age or suffer from hunger or thirst. For this reason, creatures that live on the Astral Plane (such as githyanki) establish outposts on other planes so their children can grow to maturity.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: No aging, no hunger, no thirst while on the Astral Plane.

specialRules.name: Astral Movement
specialRules.description: A traveler in the Astral Plane can move by simply thinking about moving. In combat, a creature has a Fly Speed (in feet) equal to 5 times its Intelligence score and can hover.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Fly Speed = 5 × Intelligence score (in feet). Can hover. Outside combat, movement is thought-based and distance is meaningless.

specialRules.name: Astral Navigation
specialRules.description: Thinking about a destination on the Astral Plane or in Wildspace makes the creature aware of the most direct route to that location. The creature doesn't know how long the journey will take or how perilous it will be.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Thinking about a destination reveals the most direct route. Specific destinations: 4d6 days. General locations: 1d4 × 10 hours.

domainsOrRegions.name: Wildspace
domainsOrRegions.description: Vast, airless expanses where the Astral Plane overlaps with the Material Plane. Stars and planets of the Material Plane are accessible. Creatures and objects exist on both planes simultaneously. Age normally and experience hunger/thirst.

domainsOrRegions.name: Dead Gods
domainsOrRegions.description: Petrified remains of dead gods that ended up in the Astral Plane—gods slain by more powerful entities or who lost all mortal worshipers. Look like gigantic nondescript stone statues. Sometimes turned into outposts and cities.

adventureThemes: Journey to Outer Planes or other worlds
Encountering fellow travelers
Plumbing crystallized thoughts of dead gods
Facing Astral manifestations of memories, fears, and dreams

crossReferences.description: Contains extensive information about Wildspace and Astral travel.

planes.name: Beastlands
planes.philosophicalEssence: Nature unbound. Speaks to the animal within all living creatures. Respect for physical substance and fundamental needs.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Visitors feel invigorated, minds more alert, reflexes sharpened. Hunger pangs acute but food tastes better. Sleep is always deep and restful.

temperature.description: Eternal noon, twilight, or night depending on layer.

layers.name: Krigala
layers.description: The River Oceanus is a strong torrent flowing through this wilderness of eternal summer noon.
layers.environmentalDescription: Eternal summer noon. Strong torrent of the River Oceanus.

layers.name: Brux
layers.description: A red sun hovers forever on the horizon as mists and streams roil through the trees in eternal twilight.
layers.environmentalDescription: Eternal twilight with red sun on the horizon.

layers.name: Karasuthra
layers.description: A pale moon provides the only light in this wilderness of eternal night.
layers.environmentalDescription: Eternal night lit only by a pale moon.

hazards.name: Beast Slayer Shapeshift
hazards.description: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane, the slayer must succeed on a DC 10 Charisma saving throw or shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain. The creature's game statistics are replaced by the Beast's stat block, but it retains its alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak. At the end of each Long Rest, the shape-shifted creature repeats the save. On a successful save, the creature returns to its true form. After three failed saves, the transformation can be undone only by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Whenever a visitor slays a Beast native to the plane.

onFailure.description: Shape-shift into the type of Beast that was slain. Game statistics replaced by Beast's stat block, but retains alignment, personality, creature type, Intelligence score, and ability to speak.
onFailure.duration: Until successful save at end of Long Rest or after 3 failures, only Remove Curse or similar magic
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: After three failed saves at end of Long Rests, the transformation becomes permanent and can only be undone by Remove Curse or similar magic.

onSuccess.description: No shape-shift occurs, or if already shifted, returns to true form.

savingThrowToTraverse.repeatSaveTiming: At the end of each Long Rest while shape-shifted.

adventureThemes: Good philosophies devaluing physical nature of life
Conflict with those who dismiss animals as inferior
Vibrant power of life in the natural world

planes.name: Bytopia
planes.philosophicalEssence: Personal achievement alongside social interdependence. Productive work and satisfaction of a job well done.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Goodness flowing through the plane creates feelings of goodwill and happiness.

physicalProperties.shape: Two layers facing each other like covers of a closed book, about a mile apart.

temperature.description: Dothion is pastoral and pleasant; Shurrock has rough country and harsh weather.

layers.name: Dothion
layers.description: Farms nestled among well-tamed woods are hubs of pastoral activity and individual industry. The 'top' layer.
layers.environmentalDescription: Pastoral farms and well-tamed woods.

layers.name: Shurrock
layers.description: Small communities thrive around quarries and mills amid rough country and harsh weather.
layers.environmentalDescription: Rough country, quarries, mills, harsh weather.

adventureThemes: Impact of actions mirrored on opposite layer
Quiet life versus constant self-improvement
Equal and opposite reactions

planes.name: Carceri
planes.philosophicalEssence: The grim inspiration for all other prisons. Desolation and despair. Traitors and backstabbers trapped forever.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Breeds despair and betrayal. Hatreds run like a deep, slow-moving river.

physicalProperties.shape: Long series of spherical worlds arranged like beads on a string, each consisting of six nested spheres.

temperature.description: Ranges from bogs to frigid oceans to black ice depending on layer.

layers.name: Orthrys
layers.description: The River Styx meanders through a layer of vast bogs and quicksand.
layers.environmentalDescription: Vast bogs and quicksand with the River Styx.

layers.name: Cathrys
layers.description: The stench of decay hangs over fetid jungles and scarlet plains.
layers.environmentalDescription: Fetid jungles and scarlet plains with stench of decay.

layers.name: Minethys
layers.description: Stinging sand blows in unending storms, hiding the ruins of the ancient city Payratheon.

notableLocations.name: Payratheon
notableLocations.description: Ruins of an ancient city hidden by unending sandstorms.

layers.environmentalDescription: Unending sandstorms and ruins.

layers.name: Colothys
layers.description: Deep chasms cut between cruel mountains make foot travel nearly impossible.
layers.environmentalDescription: Deep chasms and cruel mountains.

layers.name: Porphatys
layers.description: Cold, acidic oceans are fed by constant black snow.
layers.environmentalDescription: Cold acidic oceans and black snow.

layers.name: Agathys
layers.description: Black ice streaked with red covers this frigid realm.
layers.environmentalDescription: Black ice streaked with red.

escapeMethods: Secret passages (hidden, guarded by traps and deadly monsters)
River Styx (extremely dangerous, rare and expensive ferries)
blockedSpells: All spells that would transport creatures off the plane
prisonRules.portalBehavior: Portals and gates that open onto the plane become one-way only.
prisonRules.escapeRequirement: Prisoners can escape only by becoming stronger than whatever force imprisoned them there.

adventureThemes: Forces that keep characters trapped
Spiritual and psychological imprisonment
Helping prisoners escape
Resisting despair and betrayal

planes.name: Demiplanes
planes.philosophicalEssence: Extradimensional spaces with their own physical laws, shaped by the will of their creators.

notableEntities.name: Strahd von Zarovich
notableEntities.title: Vampire Lord of Barovia
notableEntities.description: The land of Barovia exists entirely within a demiplane under his sway.

adventureThemes: Exploring how characters would shape reality
Confronting distortions of reality crafted by villains

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Air
planes.philosophicalEssence: Movement, animation, and inspiration. The breath of life, the winds of change.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Mild air, except near Para-elemental Planes where temperature is more extreme.

temperature.description: Mild air except near Para-elemental Planes of Ice (cold) and Ash (hot).

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Storms ranging from thunderstorms to fierce tornadoes or mighty hurricanes.

notableEntities.name: Wind Dukes of Aaqa
notableEntities.description: Dedicated to law and good, maintain vigilant watch against Elemental Evil. Served by aarakocra.

civilizations.name: Aaqa
civilizations.description: A shining domain of silver spires and verdant gardens atop a fertile earth mote. Reachable only by following a particular sequence of flowing winds.

domainsOrRegions.name: Aaqa
domainsOrRegions.description: A shining domain of silver spires and verdant gardens atop a fertile earth mote. Home to the Wind Dukes of Aaqa.

domainsOrRegions.name: Labyrinth Winds
domainsOrRegions.description: A complex web of air streams, currents, and winds ranging from stiff breezes to howling gales. Even the most skilled flying creatures must navigate carefully.
hazards: Howling gales that can rip a creature apart

domainsOrRegions.name: Mistral Reach
domainsOrRegions.description: Located near the Para-elemental Plane of Ice. A region of frigid winds and driving snowstorms. Earth motes covered with snow and ice.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sirocco Straits
domainsOrRegions.description: The region nearest the Para-elemental Plane of Ash. Hot, dry winds scour earth motes into barren chunks of rock.

adventureThemes: Air as breath of life and winds of change
Destructive power of air turned to vengeful ends by Elemental Evil cults
Personal freedom and laying claim to things wrongfully denied

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Earth
planes.philosophicalEssence: Stability, rigidity, stern resolve, and tradition.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: No air surrounds the peaks of its highest mountains. Visitors arrive by vast caverns.

temperature.description: Varies from normal in caverns to volcanic near the Furnaces.

civilizations.name: City of Jewels
civilizations.description: The plane's largest cavern (the Great Dismal Delve / Sevenfold Mazework) is home to the City of Jewels—the capital of the dao. Every building is made from precious stones and metals. Protected by a spell that alerts the population if a visitor steals a single stone.

domainsOrRegions.name: City of Jewels
domainsOrRegions.description: Capital of the dao in the Great Dismal Delve (Sevenfold Mazework). Buildings of precious stones and metals. Protected against theft by magic.

domainsOrRegions.name: Furnaces
domainsOrRegions.description: Mountains nearest the Para-elemental Plane of Magma. Lava seeps through caverns, air reeks of sulfur. Dao forges and smelting furnaces.

domainsOrRegions.name: Mud Hills
domainsOrRegions.description: Abut the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Landslides wear away slopes, sending cascades into the bottomless swamp. The plane constantly regenerates the land.

adventureThemes: Stability and tradition
Implacable force of destruction crushing venerable institutions
Cultists of Evil Earth craving power of earthquakes and sinkholes

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Fire
planes.philosophicalEssence: Vibrancy, passion, and change. Energy, passion, transformation, and destruction.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Breathable but creatures must cover mouths and eyes to avoid stinging cinders. Sources of water are rare.

temperature.description: Heat comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Fierce winds and thick ash. Sometimes rising to hurricane force.

timeFlow.description: A blazing sun waxes and wanes on a 24-hour cycle from white hot at noon to deep red at midnight.

hazards.name: Extreme Heat
hazards.description: The heat on the Plane of Fire is comparable to a hot desert on the Material Plane and poses a similar threat to travelers.

hazards.name: Cinder Storms
hazards.description: Thick ash and fierce winds. Creatures not native to the plane must cover their mouths and eyes to avoid stinging cinders.

notableEntities.name: Torchy
notableEntities.title: Proprietor of Torchy's tavern
notableEntities.description: A sentient Flame Tongue (Mace) who sells fine ale and seems to have a new wielder every few months.

civilizations.name: City of Brass
civilizations.description: The fabled city of the efreet on the shores of the Sea of Fire. Ornate spires and spiked walls. Heart is the Charcoal Palace where the tyrannical emperor reigns.
civilizations.location: Shores of the Sea of Fire

domainsOrRegions.name: Cinder Wastes
domainsOrRegions.description: A great expanse of black cinders and embers crossed by rivers of lava. Obsidian ruins of forgotten civilizations. Roving bands of salamanders.

domainsOrRegions.name: City of Brass
domainsOrRegions.description: The fabled city of the efreet on the shores of the Sea of Fire. Ornate spires and spiked walls. The Charcoal Palace at its heart. Magic keeps cinder storms away.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Fire
domainsOrRegions.description: A great expanse of lava flowing from the Fountains of Creation. Traversed by efreeti and azer sailors in great brass ships. Islands of obsidian and basalt with ancient ruins and dragon lairs.

domainsOrRegions.name: Torchy's
domainsOrRegions.description: An iron-walled tavern built atop a tall basalt crag in the middle of a lava river. Most easily reached by hot-air balloon. Popular hangout for ballooning enthusiasts.

adventureThemes: Vibrancy, passion, and change
Light of inspiration, warmth of compassion, flame of desire
Cults of Evil Fire seeking to burn away impurities with eruptions and wildfires
Quests for legendary magic in the City of Brass
Trading in favors with efreet

planes.name: Elemental Plane of Water
planes.philosophicalEssence: Flow, rhythm of the tide, nectar of life, bitter tears, balm of sympathy and healing. Given time, it can erode all in its path.

physicalProperties.shape: An endless sea called the Sea of Worlds dotted with atolls and islands.
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Only above sea level at rare islands and atolls. Most of the plane is underwater.

temperature.description: Ranges from warm sunlit waters to frigid Sea of Ice.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Extremes—either calm or battered by storms. Several deluge rains per day. Rare rogue waves.

timeFlow.description: A warm sun arcs across the sky, rising and setting from within the water. Glittering stars and auroras at night.

civilizations.name: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls
civilizations.description: Opulent palace of coral studded with pearls. The nominal emperor's mood is as changeable as the sea. Visitors welcome to ask favors.

domainsOrRegions.name: Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls

ruler.name: Emperor of the Marids
ruler.title: Nominal Emperor
ruler.description: Mood as changeable as the sea. Visitors welcome to ask favors.

domainsOrRegions.description: Opulent palace of coral studded with pearls. Glittering centerpiece of the Sea of Light.

domainsOrRegions.name: Darkened Depths
domainsOrRegions.description: No sunlight reaches here. Horrid creatures dwell here. Absolute cold and crushing pressure. Home to krakens and other mighty leviathans.

domainsOrRegions.name: Isle of Dread
domainsOrRegions.description: Connected to the Material Plane by a storm that regularly sweeps over the island. Ships from different worlds wrecked on its rocks. Travelers who understand the storm could use it to travel to a desired Material Plane world.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Ice
domainsOrRegions.description: Borders the Para-elemental Plane of Ice. Frigid water choked with icebergs and sheet ice.

domainsOrRegions.name: Sea of Light
domainsOrRegions.description: Sunlit waters in the upper reaches. Aquatic peoples craft castles and fortresses in coral reefs.

domainsOrRegions.name: Silt Flats
domainsOrRegions.description: Nearest the Para-elemental Plane of Ooze. Water thick with soil and sludge, turning into muddy ground.

adventureThemes: Flow and erosion over time
Destructive power of surging tides and maelstroms
Cultists of Evil Water believing seas want to reclaim water from living bodies

planes.name: Elysium
planes.philosophicalEssence: The embodiment of goodness, a spiritual realm where evil can't abide. Unfettered kindness.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Tranquility and contentment seep into bones and souls. The longer a visitor remains, the less reason they find to ever leave.

layers.name: Amoria
layers.description: Small towns on the banks of the River Oceanus, surrounded by lush meadows, are among the most hospitable refuges on the Outer Planes.
layers.environmentalDescription: Small towns on River Oceanus banks with lush meadows.

layers.name: Eronia
layers.description: Steep hills, craggy mountains, and white granite valleys offer a rugged home for hardy souls.
layers.environmentalDescription: Steep hills, craggy mountains, white granite valleys.

layers.name: Belierin
layers.description: Lighthouses pierce the fog and form hubs for small communities amid sprawling marshlands. Said to be the prison of some deadly creature.
layers.environmentalDescription: Lighthouses in fog amid sprawling marshlands.

layers.name: Thalasia
layers.description: The Heroic Isles, rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus, hold the best departed souls.

notableLocations.name: Heroic Isles
notableLocations.description: Islands rising from the headwaters of the River Oceanus. Hold the best departed souls.

layers.environmentalDescription: Islands in the headwaters of the River Oceanus.

adventureThemes: Temptation to rest and enjoy reward versus devotion to doing good
Seeking ancient spirits on the Heroic Isles
Freeing or containing the prisoner in Belierin

planes.name: Ethereal Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: A misty, fog-bound dimension that overlaps the Material Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, and Inner Planes.

timeFlow.description: Distance is meaningless in the Deep Ethereal. A trip takes 1d10 × 10 hours regardless of origin and destination. In combat, creatures move at normal speeds.

hazards.name: Ether Cyclone
hazards.description: A serpentine column that spins through the plane. Appears abruptly, distorting and uprooting everything in its path. Travelers with Passive Perception 15+ receive 1 minute of warning: a deep thrum.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Travelers who can't reach a curtain or portal suffer the cyclone's effect. For the Extended Journey result (1-12), at least half the group must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma save.

onFailure.description: If fewer than half the group succeeds: journey's travel time is doubled. Individual failure contributes to group result.

onSuccess.description: If at least half the group succeeds: travel delayed by 1d10 hours.

detectionMethod.warningDescription: A deep thrum in the ethereal matter.

entries.description: Each character makes DC 15 Charisma save. If at least half succeed, delayed 1d10 hours. Otherwise, travel time doubled.
Blown to a random location in the Border Ethereal overlapping a random plane (roll on Ethereal Curtains table).
Hurled to a random destination on the Astral Plane.

portals.colorOrAppearance: Curtains of vaporous color scattered through the Deep Ethereal.

civilizations.name: Radiant Citadel
civilizations.description: A living relic carved from a single massive fossil around the Auroral Diamond gemstone. A nexus of diplomacy, trade, histories, and sanctuary. Fifteen Concord Jewels orbit the city providing transport to founding civilizations' homes.

specialRules.name: Border Ethereal Properties
specialRules.description: From the Border Ethereal, a traveler can see into the overlapped plane but it appears grayish and indistinct, limiting visibility to 30 feet. The traveler is imperceptible to those on the overlapped plane. Solid objects don't hamper movement. Exceptions: magical effects (including force) and living beings.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Can see into overlapped plane (30 ft visibility). Imperceptible to overlapped plane. Solid objects don't block movement. Magical force effects and living beings are exceptions.

specialRules.name: Deep Ethereal Travel Time
specialRules.description: A trip through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours from one curtain to another, regardless of origin and destination. In combat, creatures move at normal speeds.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Travel time: 1d10 × 10 hours between curtains. Normal speed in combat.

domainsOrRegions.name: Border Ethereal
domainsOrRegions.description: The 'shores' of the Ethereal Plane that overlap the Material Plane, Feywild, Shadowfell, and Inner Planes. Visibility usually limited to 60 feet.

domainsOrRegions.name: Deep Ethereal
domainsOrRegions.description: Region of swirling mist and fog. Visibility usually limited to 30 feet. Contains colored curtains leading to Border Ethereal regions.

domainsOrRegions.name: Radiant Citadel
domainsOrRegions.description: A floating city carved from a single massive fossil around the Auroral Diamond. Bastion of hope, nexus of diplomacy and trade. Orbited by fifteen Concord Jewels. Protected and threatened by the Keening Gloom ether cyclone.

adventureThemes: Traveling between planes
Scouting and spying from Border Ethereal
Exploring new worlds via Radiant Citadel

crossReferences.description: An anthology of short adventures based around the Radiant Citadel.

planes.name: Far Realm
planes.philosophicalEssence: Outside the known multiverse. Might be an entirely separate universe with its own physical and magical laws.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Too alien for mortal minds to accept without strain. Knowledge of the Far Realm is a struggle of the mind to overcome boundaries of matter, space, and rational thought.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Entirely alien physical and magical laws.

adventureThemes: What it means to be a person
Mental and bodily autonomy
Whether mortals have any control over fate or importance
Confronting entities beyond comprehension

planes.name: Feywild
planes.philosophicalEssence: A land of soft lights and wonder, music and magic. Gives physical expression to powerful emotion and excels at metaphor.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The plane responds to unfettered emotion. Flowers tremble at heated arguments, grass withers under malice, birds chirp merrily at joy.

temperature.description: Varies by Domain of Delight.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Mutable, as is the plane's geography. Roads change frequently.

timeFlow.description: Time and distance in the Feywild are mutable. Characters may spend a day there and find less or more time has elapsed elsewhere.

warpTable.effectDescription: Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to only minutes passing outside.
Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to only hours passing outside.
Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to weeks passing outside.
Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to months passing outside.
Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to years passing outside.

hazards.name: Feywild Memory Loss
hazards.description: A creature that leaves the Feywild makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. Fey creatures automatically succeed, as do creatures with the Fey Ancestry trait. On a failed save, the creature remembers nothing from its time in the Feywild. On success, memories remain intact but hazy. Any spell that can end a curse can restore lost memories.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: Upon leaving the Feywild, after spending at least some time there.

onFailure.description: Remembers nothing from time spent in the Feywild.

onSuccess.description: Memories remain intact but are a little hazy.

recoveryMethods: Any spell that can end a curse

portals.colorOrAppearance: Clearing, pool, circle of mushrooms, trunk of a tree—places of mystery and beauty with near-perfect mirror in the Feywild.

requirement.description: Most fey crossings open infrequently. May require full moon, dawn of a particular day, carrying a certain type of item. Closed permanently if land on either side is dramatically altered.

notableEntities.name: Queen Titania
notableEntities.title: Archfey, Ruler of the Summer Court
notableEntities.description: Rules the most settled and pastoral domain in the Feywild.

notableEntities.name: Queen of Air and Darkness
notableEntities.title: Archfey, Ruler of the Gloaming Court
notableEntities.description: Rules a realm of twilight, fireflies, cobwebs, and autumn leaves.

notableEntities.name: Yarnspinner
notableEntities.title: Archfey
notableEntities.description: A story-spinning spider archfey who loves reading stories to animals.

notableEntities.name: Zybilna
notableEntities.title: Archfey
notableEntities.description: Rules Prismeer. Regarded on some worlds as a fairy godmother of sorts, granting wishes.

domainsOrRegions.name: Fablerise

ruler.name: Yarnspinner
ruler.title: Archfey
ruler.description: A story-spinning spider archfey who loves reading stories to animals.

domainsOrRegions.description: A rambling thicket of twisted roots, thorny vines, and sinuous creepers weaving together to form tunnels, hallways, and domes.

domainsOrRegions.name: Gloaming Court
domainsOrRegions.description: A realm of twilight, fireflies, cobwebs, and autumn leaves with hooting owls and croaking frogs. Prizing intuitive and instinctual behavior.

domainsOrRegions.name: Prismeer

ruler.name: Zybilna
ruler.title: Archfey
ruler.description: Regarded as a fairy godmother, granting wishes for the lost, forsaken, or betrayed.

domainsOrRegions.description: A large domain encompassing a vast swamp (Hither), an ancient forest (Thither), and a stormy mountainous landscape (Yon). The Palace of Heart's Desire is where the three portions meet.

domainsOrRegions.name: Summer Court
domainsOrRegions.description: The most settled and pastoral domain. Wrapped in perpetual summer warmth with fluttering butterflies and colorful flowers. Values elaborate ceremony and ritualized etiquette.

adventureThemes: Stolen memories embodied in figurines or lockets
Mischievous sprites stealing emotions
Physical expression of powerful emotion
Metaphorical journeys

crossReferences.description: Prismeer is detailed in this adventure.

planes.name: Gehenna
planes.philosophicalEssence: Suspicion and greed, with no space for mercy or compassion.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Suspicion and greed. Tensions run high and trust is impossible.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Noxious fumes or searing flames from volcanic fissures.

temperature.description: Ranges from volcanic lava (Khalas, Chamada) to freezing (Mungoth) to silent darkness (Krangath).

layers.name: Khalas
layers.description: Lava illuminates clouds of volcanic ash and steam from the River Styx.

notableLocations.name: Teardrop Palace
notableLocations.description: A bustling market offering forbidden and sinister goods. Named for its shape—the point diverts lava to either side. Crowded with Fiends and occasional mortal visitors.

layers.environmentalDescription: Volcanic ash, lava, and steam from the River Styx.

layers.name: Chamada
layers.description: Constant lava flows and eruptions make overland travel difficult. Iron zeppelins piloted by yugoloths drift through constant gray ashfall.

notableLocations.name: Tower Arcane
notableLocations.description: A sinister structure adorned with blades and spikes, guarded by arcanaloths. Rumored to hold yugoloths' history and records of their contracts.

layers.environmentalDescription: Constant lava flows, eruptions, and gray ashfall.

layers.name: Mungoth
layers.description: Acidic ash mingles with falling snow on this freezing layer.
layers.environmentalDescription: Freezing with acidic ash and snow.

layers.name: Krangath
layers.description: The Dead Furnace is a great mountain suspended in silence and darkness, home to a coterie of liches.

notableLocations.name: The Dead Furnace
notableLocations.description: A great mountain suspended in silence and darkness, home to liches.

layers.environmentalDescription: Silence and darkness. A dead mountain.

hazards.name: Volcanic Terrain
hazards.description: A volcanic mountain dominates each layer. The ground inclines at least 45 degrees almost everywhere. Steep cliffs and deep canyons. Volcanic fissures vent noxious fumes or searing flames.

hazards.name: Gehenna Suspicion
hazards.description: The nature of Gehenna breeds suspicion and greed, affecting visitors' behavior.

adventureThemes: Betrayal and suspicion
Behavior when trusting no one
Yugoloths in disguise as people in need
Shopping for forbidden goods at the Teardrop Palace
Infiltrating the Tower Arcane

planes.name: Hades
planes.philosophicalEssence: Places without joy, hope, or passion. Despair manifested as apathy. Pure, undiluted evil as inescapable gravity.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Leaches away color and emotion. Slowly kills dreams and desires, draining hope and optimism.

layers.name: Oinos
layers.description: A land of dead-gray ash, stunted trees, and virulent disease is stalked by roving bands of Fiends looking for a fight or recruits for the Blood War.
layers.environmentalDescription: Dead-gray ash, stunted trees, virulent disease.

layers.name: Niflheim
layers.description: Gray pine trees blanket rolling hills and rocky bluffs, and thick mists coil around their trunks.
layers.environmentalDescription: Gray pine trees, rolling hills, thick mists.

layers.name: Pluton
layers.description: Shriveled willows, olive trees, and poplars contribute to the gloom of this concentration of the deepest despair in the multiverse.
layers.environmentalDescription: Shriveled trees and deepest despair.

hazards.name: Plane of Gloom
hazards.description: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane, a visitor makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while the creature is in Hades. If the creature reaches 6 Exhaustion levels, it doesn't die. Instead, it permanently transforms into a Larva, whereupon all Exhaustion levels are removed.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: At the end of each Long Rest taken on the plane.

onFailure.description: Gains 1 Exhaustion level that can't be removed while in Hades.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds 1 Exhaustion level. At 6 levels, creature permanently transforms into a Larva and all Exhaustion is removed.
onFailure.terminalEffect: Permanently transforms into a Larva. All Exhaustion levels are removed.

adventureThemes: Finding answer to 'why bother?'
Rekindling passion and sense of purpose
Resisting apathetic despair
Pursuing evil spellcasters collecting larvae

planes.name: Limbo
planes.philosophicalEssence: Pure chaos. A roiling soup of impermanent matter and energy. Constant change.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Visitors caught in a storm of intrusive thoughts and unruly emotions, forced to confront the transient nature of identity.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Stone melts into water that freezes into metal, then turns into diamond that burns up into smoke, on and on.

temperature.description: Constantly changing along with the matter of the plane.

civilizations.name: Githzerai Monasteries
civilizations.description: Githzerai build entire monasteries with their minds, creating enclaves of order in the chaos.

specialRules.name: Mental Object Movement
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature in Limbo can make an Intelligence check to mentally move an object within 30 feet that isn't being worn or carried. DC depends on size: Tiny DC 5, Small DC 10, Medium DC 15, Large DC 20, Huge or larger DC 25. On success, move the object 5 feet plus feet equal to how much the total exceeded the DC.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. Intelligence check. DC by size. On success: move object 5 + (total - DC) feet.

interactionCheck.name: Mental Object Movement
interactionCheck.description: Mentally move an object on Limbo that isn't worn or carried.

onSuccess.description: Move the object 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to how much the total exceeded the DC.

specialRules.name: Mental Object Alteration
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make an Intelligence check to alter a nonmagical object within 30 feet that isn't worn or carried. DC by size: Tiny DC 10, Small DC 15, Medium DC 20, Large or larger DC 25. On success, change the object into another nonliving form of the same size.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. Intelligence check. DC by size. On success: change object into another nonliving form of same size.

interactionCheck.name: Mental Object Alteration
interactionCheck.description: Alter a nonmagical object on Limbo into another nonliving form of the same size.

onSuccess.description: Change the object into another nonliving form of the same size, such as turning a boulder into a ball of fire.
onSuccess.transformationConstraints: Must be nonliving form of the same size.

specialRules.name: Mental Area Stabilization
specialRules.description: As a Magic action, a creature can make a DC 20 Intelligence check to stabilize an area within a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point it can see. On success, prevent the area from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this action again.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Magic action. DC 20 Intelligence check. On success: 30-foot-radius Sphere is stabilized for 24 hours or until the creature takes this action again.

interactionCheck.name: Mental Area Stabilization
interactionCheck.description: Stabilize an area of Limbo, preventing alteration by the plane.

onSuccess.description: Prevent the area from being altered by the plane for 24 hours or until the creature takes this Magic action again.

domainsOrRegions.name: Spawning Stone
domainsOrRegions.description: Said to have been created by Primus. Absorbs chaotic energy and makes it possible to shape enclaves of order in Limbo. The chaotic energy it absorbs is responsible for the creation of slaadi.

adventureThemes: Asserting sense of self amid constant change
Mastering internal landscape of chaos
Exploring githzerai sanctuaries
Secrets of the Spawning Stone

planes.name: Material Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Where philosophical and elemental forces collide in the jumbled existence of mortal life and matter. A thoroughly magical place.

notableEntities.name: Corellon
notableEntities.title: God
notableEntities.description: Planted and tended the great tree (seedling of Yggdrasil) on the First World at the dawn of time.

specialRules.name: Traveling Between Worlds
specialRules.description: Transit between worlds is rare but possible via: Dream of Other Worlds (magic-aided deep slumber), The Great Journey (through Wildspace/Astral or Shadowfell/Feywild), The Leap to Another Realm (Teleportation Circle, Teleport, portals), The Roots of the Worlds (nexus points existing in multiple worlds).
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Multiple methods of interworld travel available.

adventureThemes: Infinite diversity of mortal worlds
Exploring seeds of the First World
Transit between worlds

planes.name: Mechanus
planes.philosophicalEssence: Perfectly regimented order. Equal measures of light and dark, heat and cold. Law reflected in gigantic clockwork gears.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Individual consciousness subordinated to perfect order. 'I' subsumed into 'we'.

physicalProperties.shape: Gigantic clockwork gears, interlocked and turning. Structures built on cog faces.

temperature.description: Equal proportions of heat and cold.

notableEntities.name: Primus
notableEntities.title: Overlord of the Modrons
notableEntities.description: The godlike creator of the modrons. Realm is called Regulus.

civilizations.name: Modrons
civilizations.description: Primary inhabitants of Mechanus, maintaining its intricate clockworks.

adventureThemes: Examining individual egos in light of the group
Setting aside personal goals for collective benefit
Asserting individual identity distinct from the party

planes.name: Mount Celestia
planes.philosophicalEssence: The model of justice and order, celestial grace and endless mercy. Only the purest souls can reach the highest peak.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Pervasive goodness bestows blessings on creatures.

physicalProperties.shape: A sacred mountain rising from a shining Silver Sea to incomprehensible heights, with seven plateaus.

temperature.description: Ranges from the Silver Sea to snowy slopes to glittering crystal.

layers.name: Lunia
layers.description: The holy water of the Silver Sea laps at the base of the celestial mountain under a starry sky.
layers.environmentalDescription: Silver Sea at mountain base under starry sky.

layers.name: Mercuria
layers.description: Tame slopes and lush valleys are bathed in golden light that evokes the hope of a new dawn.
layers.environmentalDescription: Golden light, tame slopes, lush valleys.

layers.name: Venya
layers.description: Terraced fields and tended woodlands dot the snowy slopes.
layers.environmentalDescription: Snowy slopes with terraced fields and woodlands.

layers.name: Solania
layers.description: Holy shrines glitter under a silvery sky amid luminescent fog.
layers.environmentalDescription: Glittering shrines, silvery sky, luminescent fog.

layers.name: Mertion
layers.description: On the sweeping plains, holy soldiers muster in grand citadels for battles across the planes.

notableLocations.name: Empyrea
notableLocations.description: City on the edge of a clear lake, renowned for the healing power of its fountains and springs. Pilgrims from across the planes seek out its healers, hospitals, and restorative magic.

layers.environmentalDescription: Sweeping plains with grand citadels.

layers.name: Jovar
layers.description: Strewn with beautiful rubies and garnets, home to the seven-tiered Heavenly City.

notableLocations.name: Heavenly City
notableLocations.description: A seven-tiered city amid rubies and garnets.

layers.environmentalDescription: Rubies, garnets, and the Heavenly City.

layers.name: Chronias
layers.description: An ineffable mystery.
layers.environmentalDescription: An ineffable mystery.

environmentalEffects.name: Mount Celestia Blessings
environmentalEffects.description: The pervasive goodness of Mount Celestia bestows blessings on creatures on the plane.

adventureThemes: Proving worthiness of the plane's blessings
Forswearing selfishness, greed, and hatred
Defending against Fiend assaults
Evil's foothold through visitors' secret shame and hidden lies

planes.name: Negative Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Source of necrotic energy that destroys the living and animates the Undead. A needy, greedy plane, sucking the life out of anything vulnerable.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Only creatures with Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive for long.

temperature.description: Heat, fire, and life are drawn into the maw of this plane.

hazards.name: Life Drain
hazards.description: Merely entering the plane is comparable to the life-draining touch of a wraith. Only creatures with Immunity to Necrotic damage can survive there for long.

hazards.name: Voidstones
hazards.description: In some locations, negative energy folds in on itself, stabilizing into solid chunks of matter that devour light. Anything that comes into contact with a voidstone is destroyed in seconds. Thought to be the source of Spheres of Annihilation.

adventureThemes: Face-to-face confrontation with annihilation
Draining of vitality, energy, and happiness
Combined apathy and despair of Hades and Shadowfell

planes.name: Nine Hells
planes.philosophicalEssence: The ultimate plane of law and evil, epitome of premeditated cruelty. Devils bound to obey superiors' laws but squabble within castes.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Inflames imaginations, greed, and battle fury.

temperature.description: Ranges from fiery (Avernus, Phlegethos) to frozen (Stygia, Cania).

layers.name: Avernus
layers.description: The Blood War rages across battlefields littered with corpses and wreckage. Rocky wasteland with rivers of blood and clouds of biting flies. Fiery comets fall from darkened sky.

notableLocations.name: Zariel's Flying Citadel
notableLocations.description: A flying basalt citadel that rakes the battlefields of Avernus.

ruler.name: Zariel
ruler.title: Archduchess of Avernus
ruler.description: Appears as an angel whose skin and wings are scorched. Eyes burn with furious white light that can cause creatures to burst into flame.

layers.environmentalDescription: Rocky wasteland, rivers of blood, biting flies, fiery comets.

layers.name: Dis
layers.description: Iron roads in deep canyons lead to the dreaded Iron City of Dis. A labyrinth of canyons wedged between sheer mountains rich with iron ore.

notableLocations.name: Iron City of Dis
notableLocations.description: A hideous metropolis where planar travelers conspire with devils and close deals with Fiends. Contracts contain special provisions for Dispater's cut.

ruler.name: Dispater
ruler.title: Archduke of Dis
ruler.description: A manipulator and deceiver, devilishly handsome with small horns, tail, and cloven left hoof. One of Asmodeus's most loyal vassals.

layers.environmentalDescription: Iron canyons, iron roads, iron fortresses.

layers.name: Minauros
layers.description: Acid falls like rain on putrid bogs and decaying cities. A stench-ridden bog.

notableLocations.name: City of Minauros
notableLocations.description: Cyclopean city with slimy walls rising hundreds of feet. Lair piled high with treasures.

ruler.name: Mammon
ruler.title: Archduke of Minauros
ruler.description: Resembles a massive serpent with the upper torso and head of a hairless, horned humanoid. Legendary greed. One of few archdevils who trades favors for gold.

layers.environmentalDescription: Acidic rain, putrid bogs, stench.

layers.name: Phlegethos
layers.description: Obsidian fortresses bask in the heat of raging volcanoes and magma rivers. Seas of molten magma brew hurricanes of hot wind, smoke, and ash.

notableLocations.name: Abriymoch
notableLocations.description: Fortress city of obsidian and dark glass within a fire-filled caldera. Rivers of molten lava pour down its outer walls.

ruler.name: Belial
ruler.title: Archduke of Phlegethos (co-ruler with Fierna)
ruler.description: Exudes civility with undercurrent of threat. Rules jointly with his daughter Fierna.

layers.environmentalDescription: Volcanoes, magma rivers, smoke, ash.

layers.name: Stygia
layers.description: Levistus's prison is a frigid hellscape of jagged ice and cold fire. A frozen sea surrounds the layer.

ruler.name: Levistus
ruler.title: Archduke of Stygia
ruler.description: Encased deep in ice as punishment for betraying Asmodeus. Rules telepathically.

layers.environmentalDescription: Frozen sea, jagged ice, cold flames, crackling lightning.

layers.name: Malbolge
layers.description: An ever-crumbling mountain threatens to bury visitors. A seemingly endless slope.

notableLocations.name: Osseia
notableLocations.description: Glasya's citadel supported by cracked pillars and buttresses. Beneath it lies a labyrinth of cells and torture chambers.

ruler.name: Glasya
ruler.title: Archduchess of Malbolge
ruler.description: Asmodeus's daughter. Cruelty and love of wicked schemes rival those of her father.

layers.environmentalDescription: Endless crumbling slope with deadly avalanches.

layers.name: Maladomini
layers.description: Swarms of hungry flies plague dead cities surrounded by utter desolation. A ruin-covered wasteland.

ruler.name: Baalzebul
ruler.title: Lord of Flies, Archduke of Maladomini
ruler.description: A tall, powerful devil with compound eyes of a fly. Cursed by Asmodeus so any deal he makes leads to calamity.

layers.environmentalDescription: Desolate ruins, dead cities, swarms of flies.

layers.name: Cania
layers.description: Ice-trapped cities provide shelter in a realm cold enough to freeze the soul. Frozen hellscape with ice storms.

notableLocations.name: Mephistar
notableLocations.description: An ice citadel where Mephistopheles plots to seize the throne of the Nine Hells.

ruler.name: Mephistopheles
ruler.title: Archduke of Cania
ruler.description: Brilliant and conniving. Asmodeus's greatest enemy and ally. A tall, striking devil with impressive horns and cool demeanor.

layers.environmentalDescription: Frozen hellscape, ice storms that can tear flesh from bone.

layers.name: Nessus
layers.description: Mighty fortresses stand watch over the deepest pits of the Nine Hells. A realm of dark pits with bleak fortresses.

notableLocations.name: Malsheem
notableLocations.description: A gigantic hollowed-out stalagmite citadel-spire rising from a vast rift. Home to Asmodeus and his infernal court. Also a prison for souls.

ruler.name: Asmodeus
ruler.title: Archduke of Nessus, Supreme Ruler of the Nine Hells
ruler.description: Most cunning and well-mannered of archdevils. Appears as a handsome bearded man with four large horns, piercing red eyes, and flowing robes. Wields power of a lesser god.

layers.environmentalDescription: Dark pits, bleak fortresses, the great citadel-spire of Malsheem.

timeFlow.description: Distance is virtually meaningless. A guided tour from first to ninth layer could take a single day or weeks.

notableEntities.name: Asmodeus
notableEntities.title: Archduke of Nessus, Supreme Ruler
notableEntities.description: Most cunning archdevil, wields power of a lesser god.

notableEntities.name: Tiamat
notableEntities.title: Queen of Evil Dragons
notableEntities.description: Prisoner on Avernus, ruling her own domain but confined by Asmodeus.

notableEntities.name: Baalzebul

planes.name: Pandemonium
planes.philosophicalEssence: Overwhelming chaos. Cold, noisy, and dark, with no natural light. The plane of last straws.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Incessant howling brings everyone to the edge of lashing out in frustration, breaking down in despair, or dissolving into incoherence.

physicalProperties.shape: A great mass of rock riddled with tunnels carved by howling winds.
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Cold, noisy, dark, no natural light.

layers.name: Pandesmos
layers.description: Howling winds, dark streams bound for the River Styx, and blowing snow pour through vast, desolate caverns.
layers.environmentalDescription: Vast desolate caverns with howling winds and snow.

layers.name: Cocytus
layers.description: Winds blowing through narrower tunnels create a stronger force and louder wails.

notableLocations.name: Howler's Crag
notableLocations.description: A jagged spike rumored to have a unique magical property: anything yelled from the top finds the ears of its intended recipient, carried on a shrieking frigid wind, no matter where in the multiverse that person might be.

layers.environmentalDescription: Narrow tunnels with stronger winds and louder wails.

layers.name: Phlegethon
layers.description: Tunnel walls absorb light while water creates intricate rock formations.
layers.environmentalDescription: Light-absorbing walls and intricate rock formations.

layers.name: Agathion
layers.description: Sealed-off tunnels are largely inaccessible from elsewhere, making them ideal as vaults for ancient secrets.
layers.environmentalDescription: Sealed-off tunnels vaulting ancient secrets.

hazards.name: Howling Winds of Pandemonium
hazards.description: Wind quickly extinguishes nonmagical open flames such as torches and campfires. It also makes conversation possible only by yelling, and even then only to a maximum distance of 10 feet.

effectOnConversation.reason: Howling winds drown out normal speech.

adventureThemes: What happens to characters on their worst day
Everything going wrong with no respite
Frustration and despair from incessant howling
Communicating secrets via Howler's Crag

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ash
planes.philosophicalEssence: Movement and change given a destructive tone by raging conflagration. Commonality between air and fire.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Thick ash obscures sight beyond a few dozen feet.
physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Endless storm of flames, smoke, and ash.

adventureThemes: Interaction between air and fire elements
Destructive change

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ice
planes.philosophicalEssence: Border between Air and Water. Strength and survival in the face of bitter cold.
adventureThemes: Proving strength and ensuring survival
Bitter cold and endless glacier

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Magma
planes.philosophicalEssence: Boundary between Earth and Fire. Creation and destruction through volcanic forces.
adventureThemes: Creation through volcanic forces

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Ooze
planes.philosophicalEssence: Border between Water and Earth. Contrast between stable earth and flowing water. Objects cast here can't be found for at least a century.
adventureThemes: Seeking artifacts lost in the swamp
Contrast between stability and flow
Monstrous insects and hags

planes.name: Positive Plane
planes.philosophicalEssence: Source of radiant energy and raw life force. A continual furnace of creation, domain of brilliance.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Visitors empowered. Leaves lasting charge making it hard to calm down, stem ideas, or sleep. Persistent resistance to disease and despair.

physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Like the Plane of Air in wide-open nature, but every bit glows brightly with innate power.

temperature.description: Like the heart of a star.

hazards.name: Overwhelming Radiance
hazards.description: Every bit of this plane glows brightly with innate power. This power is dangerous to mortal forms, which can't handle it for long. Only creatures that have Immunity to Radiant damage can survive there.

adventureThemes: Vibrant life and creative energy
Touching fundamental energy is as dangerous as annihilation
Lasting charge of energy after visiting

planes.name: Shadowfell
planes.philosophicalEssence: A gloomy dimension of death, gloom, and dread. Distorted and sinister reflections of the Material Plane.
planes.emotionalInfluence: Melancholic atmosphere pervades. Extended forays afflict characters with despair.

hazards.name: Shadowfell Despair
hazards.description: When the DM deems it appropriate (usually not more than once per day), a character not from the Shadowfell makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On failure, affected by despair (roll d6): 1-3 Apathy (Disadvantage on Death Saves and Initiative), 4-5 Dread (Disadvantage on all saving throws), 6 Delusion (Disadvantage on ability checks and saves using Int, Wis, or Cha). New despair replaces old. After Long Rest, DC 15 Wisdom save to end.

savingThrowToTraverse.triggerDescription: When the DM deems it appropriate, usually not more than once per day. Only characters not native to the Shadowfell.

onFailure.description: Affected by despair. Roll d6: 1-3 Apathy (Disadvantage on Death Saves and Initiative), 4-5 Dread (Disadvantage on all saving throws), 6 Delusion (Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws using Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma).
onFailure.duration: Until removed by DC 15 Wisdom save after Long Rest, Calm Emotions, or curse removal magic.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: New despair replaces old despair effect.

savingThrowToTraverse.recoveryTrigger: After finishing a Long Rest, the character can attempt a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw to end the despair.
recoveryMethods: DC 15 Wisdom saving throw after Long Rest

entries.durationDescription: Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws and Initiative rolls until cured.

Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma until cured.

globalPlanarConnections.name: Infinite Staircase
globalPlanarConnections.description: An extradimensional staircase that connects the planes. Entrance appears as a nondescript door. Changes appearance as it climbs and descends—simple stairs to chaotic jumble of stairs in radiant space. Includes ramps, hovering platforms, and clockwork conveyor belts. Doors often tucked in dusty, half-forgotten places. Home to Nafas, a noble genie.
hazards: Guarded by devas, sphinxes, yugoloths, and other powerful monsters

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Oceanus
globalPlanarConnections.description: Sweet and fragrant water with headwaters in Thalasia, the lowest layer of Elysium. Flows through each of Elysium's layers, passes through the top layer of the Beastlands, streams across the top layer of Arborea, and drains away in Arborea's second layer. Trading vessels sail up and down its length, and small towns line its banks.

globalPlanarConnections.name: River Styx
globalPlanarConnections.description: Bubbles with grease, foul flotsam, and putrid remains of battles. Churns through the top layers of Acheron, the Nine Hells, Gehenna, Hades, Carceri, the Abyss, and Pandemonium. Tributaries snake through lower layers. Sinister ferries crewed by pilots carry passengers for a price.
hazards: Ill effects of the Styx (see 'Hazards' in chapter 3)

globalPlanarConnections.name: Yggdrasil, the World Tree
globalPlanarConnections.description: A cosmic ash tree spanning the Outer Planes and linking them to many worlds of the Material Plane. Roots stretch into the Lower Planes (Hades, Pandemonium, possibly others). Trunk rises through Ysgard. Branches stretch through Upper Planes and across the Astral to the Material Plane. Expert guides study ever-changing paths as the tree grows eternally.

bloodWar.description: Throughout history, the teeming demon hordes of the Abyss and the regimented legions of devils from the Nine Hells have battled for supremacy in the cosmos. The Blood War has raged for millennia, ravaging the Lower Planes. A moment never goes by when demons and devils aren't battling each other somewhere in the multiverse.

factions.name: Demons
factions.role: Teeming hordes seeking to overwhelm through chaos and numbers.

factions.name: Devils
factions.role: Regimented legions seeking supremacy through law and strategy.

bloodWar.adventureImplications: Many demons and devils are obsessed with finding advantage. Powerful mortal adventurers are sometimes drawn into tangled schemes. Natives of the Upper Planes take steps to minimize the threat, and angels and other emissaries stand ready to intervene when the Blood War spills outside its primary planes.

planarTravelMethods.description: Stationary interplanar connections linking specific locations on different planes. Some function like doorways, others are locations existing on multiple planes, and some are vortices joining elemental planes with similar Material Plane locations.
requirements: Meeting the portal's requirements (command, key item, random, situation, or time)

planarTravelMethods.name: Spells
planarTravelMethods.description: A number of spells allow direct or indirect access to different planes of existence.

planarTravelMethods.name: Fey Crossings
planarTravelMethods.description: Places of mystery and beauty on the Material Plane with near-perfect mirror in the Feywild. Passing through is as simple as entering a clearing, wading into a pool, or crawling under a tree.
requirements: Meeting opening conditions (full moon, specific day, carrying specific item)

planarTravelMethods.name: Shadow Crossings
planarTravelMethods.description: Locations where the veil between Material Plane and Shadowfell is thin. Form in gloomy places where spirits or death lingers. Manifest only in darkness.

planarTravelMethods.name: Nexus Points
planarTravelMethods.description: Locations that exist in multiple worlds at the same time. May be geographical features (enormous tree, mountain, cavern, meteorite crater) or constructed features (tower, castle, tavern, city). Some flit from world to world on a schedule.
requirements: May require magic, an object from the destination world, or nothing more than an act of will
destinations: Other worlds on the Material Plane

planarTravelMethods.name: Dream of Other Worlds
planarTravelMethods.description: Aided by magic, travelers can fall into a deep slumber and dream themselves into a new realm.
destinations: Other worlds on the Material Plane

planarTravelMethods.name: The Great Journey
planarTravelMethods.description: An epic voyage through Wildspace and across the Astral Plane aboard a vessel powered by magic, or through the Shadowfell or Feywild.
destinations: Other worlds on the Material Plane

planarAdventureSituations.situation: When magic fails to revive a dead person, the only solution is to venture to the Outer Planes to find the person's spirit and either release it from some prison or convince the person to return to life.

People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.
A long-dead oracle is the only one who knows how a terrible prophecy might be averted, but the cataclysmic fulfillment of the prophecy has already begun.
A god has stopped answering prayers and won't respond to any Commune spell.
A devil has tricked an angel into meddling in the Blood War, and the angel seeks mortal aid.
An ancestor of one of the characters must be convinced to bless the character before the full power of the character's bloodline can be unleashed.
A foolhardy knight carried a holy weapon on a doomed mission into the Nine Hells, and the powers of Mount Celestia want the weapon and the knight's remains retrieved.
A titan is imprisoned on an Outer Plane. The characters might be trying to stop those who seek to release it, or they might want to release it to help defend the world from a greater threat.

To prove themselves worthy of an even greater quest, the characters are sent to slay a horrible monster, win the favor of a powerful planar being, negotiate peace between two warring planar factions, or retrieve a long-lost item on another plane.
An item of legend is being sold at auction in Sigil, the City of Brass, or some other planar metropolis.

globalPlanarDissonance.description: Celestials who visit the Lower Planes and Fiends who visit the Upper Planes experience significant discomfort if their visits last more than a few hours. After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to its nature, a Celestial or Fiend makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save and ends when the creature finishes a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: After finishing a Long Rest on a plane that is alien to its nature.

onFailure.description: Whenever the creature makes a D20 Test, the creature must subtract 1d4 from the roll. The effect is cumulative with each failed save.
onFailure.cumulativeDescription: Each failed save adds another 1d4 subtracted from all D20 Tests. Multiple penalties stack.

savingThrow.recoveryTrigger: Finishes a Long Rest on a plane that isn't opposed to its nature.
recoveryMethods: Long Rest on a non-opposed plane
